programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Wake Forest visits North Carolina. The rivals have split the past six meetings after each program defended home court last season. Tar Heels center Armando Bacot averaged 19 points and 10 rebounds in the 2022-23 meetings with the Demon Deacons.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Jayhawks share the floor with a new Big 12 rival in the Bearcats. Kansas has won 14 straight at home, and is 9-0 at the Allen Fieldhouse this season. Hunter Dickinson (KU) has totaled 54 points and 25 rebounds across his last two home dates.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Sooners welcome a challenge from the Longhorns. Oklahoma has dropped its past five against the defending Big 12 champions. Texas drew headlines when it lost to UCF at home Jan. 17, but bounced back by knocking off then-No. 9 Baylor on Jan. 20.

programme.title: 2024 Australian Open Tennis
programme.desc: From Melbourne Park in Melbourne, Australia.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: "NBA Countdown" serves as the primer for game telecasts on the ESPN family of networks. It's highlighted by a lively roundtable discussion and debate of the top storylines around the league. Seats at the table are reserved for folks in ESPN's stable of NBA hosts and analysts, with the latter group imparting wisdom based on their many years of playing experience.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Tigers (16-2, 5-0) roar into their rivalry game versus the Crimson Tide (12-6, 4-1) in Tuscaloosa, Ala. Auburn has won 11 straight after routing then-No. 22 Ole Miss 82-59. Alabama had a six-game win streak halted at then-No. 6 Tennessee 91-71.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Chet Holmgren and the Thunder pay Victor Wembanyama and the Spurs a visit. Holmgren won the first head-to-head between standout rookies Nov. 14, 2023. However, neither youngster cracked double-digit points as Oklahoma City blasted San Antonio 123-87.

programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The Utes complete a tricky stretch by tipping off against the Bruins. When Utah entered the Pac-12, UCLA dominated the matchup with 17 straight wins, but the Utes have claimed the last two meetings, with Jenna Johnson averaging 13 points.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Seminoles visit the Orange. On Jan. 20, Florida State's five-game run ended with a home setback to Clemson, while Syracuse hit a buzzer-beating 3-pointer to defeat Miami. Judah Mintz (SYR) posted his first double-double of the season in that win.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Horned Frogs (13-5, 2-3 Big 12) aim to get right when they visit the Cowboys (8-10, 0-5). TCU has lost two straight for the first time this season after a one-point loss to Iowa State on Jan. 20. Oklahoma State is 7-4 at Gallagher-Iba Arena.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Hurricanes and Fighting Irish, mired in similar slides, share the court in South Bend, Ind. Both programs have dropped four of their past five overall. Indiana native Nijel Pack is one of four Canes averaging at least 14 points per game.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Kansas State dives into a challenging stretch by visiting longtime rival Iowa State. On this day last year, the Cyclones used a strong second half to pull away from a top-five-ranked Wildcats squad, 80-76. Tamin Lipsey (ISU) had 10 points in the win.

programme.desc: Start the day off right with Chris Canty, Evan Cohen and Michelle Smallmon providing an energizing and informative way to take on the day. Sports, life and laughter are what it's all about.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: 2024 Australian Open Tennis
programme.desc: From Melbourne Park in Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The Red Storm and Pirates feature in this Big East affair. St. John's has won four of five since the calendar flipped to 2024. Seton Hall beat St. John's twice in 2022-23. Fifth-year guard Unique Drake paces the Storm with 18.2 points per game.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The Bears play host to the Wildcats. Kansas State pummeled Baylor 87-68 in the final head-to-head of 2022-23 for their second win in four tries. Prior to that stretch, the Bears had dominated the series, winning 36 straight meetings.

programme.title: 2024 CONMEBOL Pre-Olympic Soccer Tournament
programme.desc: From Misael Delgado Multisport Stadium in Carabobo, Bolvar, Venezuela.

programme.title: Road to UEFA Euro 2024 Magazine
programme.desc: Updates on the path teams must take to qualify for UEFA Euro 2024.

programme.desc: Gossip and exclusive stories about athletes' personal lives.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Hoyas welcome a challenge from the Bulldogs. Butler's total team effort fueled a 74-64 triumph over Georgetown on Dec. 19, 2023. Six members of Butler scored at least eight points in that win. Jayden Epps (GTWN) is averaging 18.8 points per game.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Musketeers (10-8, 4-3 Big East) aim to continue their charge as they face the Bluejays (14-5, 5-3). Xavier has won three in a row to try and turn around an inconsistent season, and boasts wins in five of the last six against Creighton.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Broncos (13-5, 4-1 MWC), fresh off a triumph, visit the Bulldogs (8-10, 1-4). Boise State survived a late comeback bid from San Diego State to secure a 67-66 win on Jan. 20. Fresno State seeks its first home victory over Boise State since 2019.
